Package mms.storage

Class MovingTruck

Object
Storage
MovingTruck
public class MovingTruck extends Storage
A moving truck to facilitate moving different items on a road.
A moving truck has 2 sections, the cab and the storage space. The cab is 1.5 m in length.
Implement this for Assignment 1

  • Method Details

    • pack

      public void pack(Packable item) throws PackingException
      Adds an item to the moving truck's internal list.

      If the moving truck is at capacity or adding the item to this moving truck causes the sum of the elements' width, height, length or weight to be greater than the width, height, length or weight (respectively) of this moving truck than an exception should be thrown and no action should be taken.
      The length of the moving truck should be 1500 less than the given length as that is the true length of the storage space.

      Once an item of the Furniture class has been added to the list, only other Furniture items may be added until all the Furniture items have been removed. That is, if the number of furniture items in the truck is > 0 then only furniture items may be added, else any Packable item can be added.

      Overrides:
      pack in class Storage
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add to the list
      Throws:
      StorageFullException - if ∑ lengths of items in the moving truck + length of new item > moving truck storage area length
      BadItemException - if the there is a furniture item on the truck and a non-furniture item is being added
      StorageFullException - if the current elements size >= the capacity of this storage or if two of the following are true:
      ∑ widths of items in the storage + width of new item > storage width,
      ∑ heights of items in the storage + height of new item > storage height,
      ∑ lengths of items in the storage + length of new item > storage length
      PackingException
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • unpack

      public Packable unpack()
      Removes an item from the moving trucks internal list.

      The moving truck is unpacked in a particular order.
      First, all furniture is removed in First In, First Out format.
      After all the furniture is removed, the remaining items should be unpacked in a First In, Last Out (FILO) format.

      Overrides:
      unpack in class Storage
      Returns:
      item from the list
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the human-readable string representation of the moving truck.

      The format of the string to return is: 

      MovingTruck ('capacity'/'totalCapacity')

      Where:

      • 'capacity' is this current number of items on board this moving truck.
      • 'totalCapacity' is this moving truck's maximum capacity.

      The storage's width, height and length should be formatted to two decimal places.

      For example: 

      MovingTruck (14/20)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Storage
      Returns:
      string representation of this moving truck
      See Also:
      • Box.toString()
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • getMultiplier

      protected int getMultiplier()
      Returns the multiplier of a moving truck.

      The value of the multiplier for a moving truck is four (4).

      Specified by:

    • getVolume

      public double getVolume()
      Return the volume of the moving truck's storage area in cm3.

      With volume of a moving truck's storage area is the width × height × (length - 1500).

      Returns:
      volume of this moving truck's storage area
      Implement this for Assignment 1
